Get all access groups for a specific entity.
The entity ID. Size of the page. 0 = no paging The page number. (Optional) True to include, false to exclude the children. (Optional) The property to sort the results by (Optional) Specifies if the results should be returned in ascending or descending order. (Optional) Specify False to exclude the No Access, Unlimited and Personal access groups.
The access groups for the entity. =================================================================================================

Get all access groups for a cluster.
The cluster UID. Size of the page. 0 = no paging The page number. (Optional) True to include, false to exclude the children. (Optional) The property to sort the results by (Optional) Specifies if the results should be returned in ascending or descending order. (Optional) Specify False to exclude the No Access, Unlimited and Personal access groups. The access groups for cluster. =================================================================================================

A Task<ActionResult<ApiEntities.AccessGroup>> =================================================================================================

member.name: T:GalaxySMS.Api.Controllers.Api.AuthController
member.summary: Manage user authentication operations such as sign in and sign out

member.name: M:GalaxySMS.Api.Controllers.Api.AuthController.SignInAsync(GalaxySMS.Business.Entities.Api.NetCore.UserSignInRequest)
member.remarks: Use this to sign in to a specific application and obtain a token along with entities and roles/permissions

members.member:
Verify two factor authentication token.
Validate a two-factor authentication. Requires Authorization Bearer header which was returned from a prior call to api/auth/signinrequest Information describing the request.
A Task<ActionResult<ApiEntities.UserSignInResult>> =================================================================================================

Sign out user.
Sign out by passing the SessionId value in the request body. Requires Authorization Bearer header
A Task<ActionResult<ApiEntities.UserSessionToken>> =================================================================================================

Keep session alive. Refresh the session expiration time so that it does not go stale
A Task<ActionResult<ApiEntities.UserSessionToken>> =================================================================================================

Decodes the JSON Web Token and returns the decoded values
A Task<ActionResult<JwtSecurityToken>> =================================================================================================

updates the session settings described by parameters.
Options for controlling the operation.
A Task<ActionResult<ApiEntities.UserSessionToken>> =================================================================================================

Operations relating Entities. An entity is a foundational element of the system. Most all data items in the system are associated with an entity. Entities are used to separate, isolate or partition data within the system. An entity can be thought of as a customer or tenant in a multi-tenant application. Entities can also be used to represent a department or division within a larger organization where the data needs to be separated or isolated from other groups within the organization. Individual data items such as persons, regions, sites, time schedules and users are all associated with a specific entity. Entities can be hierarchical in nature where an entity can have child entities. In this scenario, the parent entity can access its childrens data items.
=================================================================================================

Get a collection of gcsEntity objects.
Size of the page. 0 = no paging The page number. (Optional) True to include photo, false to exclude the photo. (Optional) Width of the photo in pixels (0 = full size). (Optional) True to include, false to exclude the children. (True can significantly increase response time and body size) (Optional) True to only include counts of data elements in the response. (Optional) The property to sort the results by (EntityName, InsertDate, UpdateDate) (Optional) Specifies if the results should be returned in ascending (asc, default) or descending (desc) order.
A Task<ActionResult<ApiEntities.gcsEntity[]>> =================================================================================================

Get Entities by name or description. If the search text is found anywhere in the name or description, the entity will be included in the response.

The entities by name or description. =================================================================================================

Operations relating Entities. An system is a foundational element of the system. Most all data items in the system are associated with an system. Entities are used to separate, isolate or partition data within the system. An system can be thought of as a customer or tenant in a multi-tenant application. Entities can also be used to represent a department or division within a larger organization where the data needs to be separated or isolated from other groups within the organization. Individual data items such as persons, regions, sites, time schedules and users are all associated with a specific system. Entities can be hierarchical in nature where an system can have child entities. In this scenario, the parent system can access its childrens data items.
=================================================================================================

searches for the persons by a variety of search criteria
Valid SearchType values: AllRecords (0), ByPersonUid (1), ByPersonId (2), ByPersonActiveStatusTypeUid (3), ByDepartmentUid (4), ByPersonRecordTypeUid (5), ByLastFirstName (6), ByFields (7), ByCredentialNumber (8), ByCredentialFieldValues (9), ByCredentialFieldValue (10), ByOriginId (11), ByLastUpdatedDate (12), ByAccessProfileUid (13), ByAnyNameField (14)
Options for controlling the operation. (Optional) The unique ID of the entity to request person data for. If not specified or '00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000' is specified, the currentEntityId for the user session will be used. Size of the page. 0 = no paging The page number. The property to sort the results by The order to return results in, either ascending (asc) or descending (desc)
A Task<ActionResult<ApiEntities.PersonSummaryBasic[]>> =================================================================================================

Operations relating Entities. An system is a foundational element of the system. Most all data items in the system are associated with an system. Entities are used to separate, isolate or partition data within the system. An system can be thought of as a customer or tenant in a multi-tenant application. Entities can also be used to represent a department or division within a larger organization where the data needs to be separated or isolated from other groups within the organization. Individual data items such as persons, regions, sites, time schedules and users are all associated with a specific system. Entities can be hierarchical in nature where an system can have child entities. In this scenario, the parent system can access its childrens data items.
=================================================================================================

Get a single of gcsSystem object based on systemId (unique id (Guid or uuid) value).
Identifier for the system. (Optional) False to return the full record including properties that cannot be updated via PUT. True to return the data in a format that can be directly used to update the record via PUT A Task<ActionResult<ApiEntities.gcsSystem[]>> =================================================================================================

Updates an existing gcsSystem item. Can also create a new gcsSystem if the SystemId property is specified
Options for controlling the operation.
A Task<ActionResult<ApiEntities.gcsSystem>> =================================================================================================

Operations relating Entities. An user is a foundational element of the system. Most all data items in the system are associated with an user. Entities are used to separate, isolate or partition data within the system. An user can be thought of as a customer or tenant in a multi-tenant application. Entities can also be used to represent a department or division within a larger organization where the data needs to be separated or isolated from other groups within the organization. Individual data items such as persons, regions, sites, time schedules and users are all associated with a specific user. Entities can be hierarchical in nature where an user can have child entities. In this scenario, the parent user can access its childrens data items.
=================================================================================================

Get a collection of gcsUser objects.
(Optional) The unique ID of the entity to request users for. If not specified, users for current entity will be requested. Size of the page. 0 = no paging The page number. (Optional) True to include photo, false to exclude the photo. (Optional) Width of the photo in pixels (0 = full size).
(Optional) The property to sort the results by (UserName, InsertDate, UpdateDate, Email, LastLoginDate) (Optional) Specifies if the results should be returned in ascending (asc, default) or descending (desc) order.
A Task<ActionResult<ApiEntities.gcsUserBasic[]>> =================================================================================================

Get a single of gcsUser object based on userId (unique id (Guid or uuid) value).
Identifier for the user. (Optional) Comma-separated list of property names to include in the response

Updates an existing gcsUser item. Can also create a new gcsUser if the EntityId property is specified

Get user editor data
Kevin, 11/23/2021.
(Optional) True to include photo image data, false to exclude the photo. (Optional) Width of the photo in pixels (0 = full size). (Optional) True to include, false to exclude the member collections. (Optional) True to exclude all roles that have the IsAuthorized property = false, false to include all roles. (Optional) True to exclude all applications that have the IsAuthorized property = false, false to include all applications. (Optional) Identifier for the application. Omit or specify 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000 to include all applications
